intro: Vibexia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. Vibexia species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They produce small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain environments.
